lines.text: [Major Renault explains Captain Hart's next mission]
And this isn't going to be easy because of Chief Selangi.
Chief Selangi, sir? Who's he?

One of the tribal leaders. A scoundrel - a Nazi quisling. He's been traveling all over the colony trying to raise a fifth column for Hitler. I need not remind you this is worse than all the dangers of the jungle.
This isn't Broadway and 42nd Street - what were you dreaming about?
I was dancin' with two of the most beautiful dolls you've ever seen - all suntanned like at Coney Island - and wearing sarongs!
Listen, Junior, the glamour girls in Africa are just a trifle more than suntanned.
Yeah?
Yeah. And they don't wear sarongs.
But Chief Selangi started eighth column here!
No - fifth column. And fifth column or eighth column, you're not helping any by starting a war now.
Cheer up, sweetheart. You'll soon be up to your ears in work and you won't have time to think about women.
Yeah. That's what I'm afraid of.
A mere slip of a girl must not obstruct the destiny of the New Order.
[the beautiful Kuhlaya, clad in a scanty sarong, gestures for Hart and Jenkins to follow]
I wonder what her game is.
What ever it is, I'll play - on her team!
You look as if you've gone through ten wars, Captain.
Lady, what happened to us should happen to Hitler.
Captain, you're looking at Carabi's guardian angel.
Not only Carabi's, Doctor - ours as well.
Sure, Doc. If it wasn't for her, we'd be cannibal pot roast right now.
[Mike flexes his muscles]
Hey, another ten days of this and I'll have a physique like Buster Crabbe!
What about that gal?
What gal?
What gal? You know what gal - Lukas' wife. Did she really come up to you last night to warn you?
Yep.
Anything else?
Anything else, Junior, is a military secret.
All right, Captain Casanova.
[Kuhlaya, using her bow and arrows, rescues Gary and Mike from an ambush]
If it ain't William Tell in a sarong!
[Chief Selangi makes an impassioned speech to the native tribesmen]
What is he saying?
He's convincing them that the Americans have brought the plague and should die. I believe your friend Captain Hart will find it difficult to cope with this problem.
You mean they will kill him?
Naturally, after they torture him for a bit.
It's a fine thing for a guy from Brooklyn to have to die in a briar patch like this.
